definition: grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Bai Yuping is looking at the husband of light up with pleasure, as if looking at a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 白玉萍望着喜笑颜开的丈夫，仿佛望着一个陌生人。

sentences.english: His face lit up with pleasure when she came in.
sentences.chinese: 当她进来时，他马上喜笑颜开。

sentences.english: Looking at the grain piled high in the courtyard , the whole family were wreathed in smiles.
sentences.chinese: 看着院子里堆成山的粮食，全家人都喜笑颜开。

sentences.english: As soon as the old man sees his grandchild his face lights up.
sentences.chinese: 老人一见到孙子就喜笑颜开的。

sentences.english: His face lit up with pleasure when news came that his essay had won first prize.
sentences.chinese: 听说他的文章获得了一等奖，他喜笑颜开。

sentences.english: Memories cgreabout make you smile sometimes likewise cry sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 回忆，有时令你嘴角上扬，也能让你喜笑颜开。

sentences.english: She smiled at me on the subway.
sentences.chinese: 在那地下铁，她对我喜笑颜开。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
unable to conceal one's happiness, amazement, shock etc/grinning from ear to ear/mouth agape/gobsmacked
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
